Paul Hirsch (born November 14, 1945) is an American motion picture editor.
He was an art history major who dropped out of Columbia University graduate school to pursue a career in editing trailers and montages. In the early 1970s he was introduced by his brother, Charles, to then-unknown filmmaker Brian De Palma.
In 1978, he, along with Richard Chew and Marcia Lucas, won the Academy Award for Film Editing for his work on Star Wars.
